result.execSummary:
Darion M Butler was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Darion M Butler was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on June 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Warrant for Commitment signed by Judge Laura Lau 05/20/2022.

09:52 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Darion M Butler in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes this is an extradition case and inquires how the matter will be proceeding.  Atty. Gutierrez provides and update; he notes the defendant is prepared to waive extradition and sign the paperwork.  Atty. Gutierrez is also asking the court set time limits, sign the order for commitment and set the matter over for another date.  Court takes a brief recess at 9:54 a.m. to allow time for the State to obtain the paperwork for the waiver of extradition.  Case recalled at 10:19 a.m.; all appearances remain the same.  Court has received and signed the Waiver of Extradition paperwork.  Atty. Gutierrez requests the court sign the Warrant for Commitment.  State is also asking the matter be set for a review hearing in about 30 days to verify the defendant was picked up on the extradition warrant.  Court has signed the Waiver of Extradition, Warrant for Commitment, and will order bail be revoked.  Court adjourns for review hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Request for Substitution against Judge Michael Bohren, received on today's date. Filed by Atty Kees.   **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on May 16, 2022 - APPROVED.**

01:55 PM Defendant Darion M Butler in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Attorney Kees presents bail arguments.
The State presents bail arguments.
The Court will not modify bail at this time and will still have the Defendant remanded into the custody of the Waukesha County Jail.
The Defendant is contesting the extradtion. 

Request for Substitution against Judge Michael Bohren, received on today's date. Filed by Atty Kees.

ADDRESS INFO for Darion M Butler
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 05-13-2022)
Prior: 538 E 72nd St, Chicago, IL 60619

02:10 PM Defendant Darion M Butler in court, in custody.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and reading of complaint done in Court.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises the rights of extradition. 
Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Defendant is requesting an attorney.

The State places its bail recommendation on the record.
The Defendant remains silent on bail.
THE COURT REMANDS THE DEFENDANT INTO THE CUSTODY OF THE WAUEKSHA COUNTY JAIL.

The Court will adjourn the matter so the Defendant can be seen by the SPD.  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
